transcript.text: Mister President of the Republic,
I've been waiting for you.
Here you are at last.

France has been waiting
 for our confrontation.
Now it can start.
Mister President of the Republic,
France has not yet said its last word,
and it gave me a message for you.
I am sure you are going to listen
with the greatest attention.
France has asked me to tell you you have failed.
The French have asked me to tell you

they're scared for their children,
 their grandchildren,

their parents, their grandparents
 and their country.
You have had five long years to act,
but you have done almost nothing.
You have had five long years
to show you love the French,
but you still cannot do it.
We have grown tired of your "at the same time",
and it has shown its limits.
Yes, our country has become unbearable to live in,
and you have become the cause of this.
The French are suffering
from the upsurge in violence in our country.
A street violence, a daily violence.

Our daughters are attacked,
 our teachers are beaten up,
Our police are shot at and they can't shoot back.
You have sacrificed the security of the French.

Even worse, you have sacrificed
 France's identity.

For five years, you have let
 several million immigrants
enter our country.
We have given them homes, we have treated them,
We have helped them... with French people's money.
We can no longer take in the whole world
while so many of our compatriots are suffering
and surviving in misery.
We can no longer be so unfair
with millions of retirees, employees,
entrepreneurs, students and single mothers,
who can no longer make ends meet,

while millions of immigrants
 are taking advantage of welfare benefits
without having to work.
You and your ministers' arrogance
has pushed millions of French people,
who'd never protested, into the streets.
Millions of French people who only wanted
to have jobs and live from their work,
without the state taking everything from them,
racketeering them,
being so cruel with them
yet so weak with criminals.

You have accelerated
 the downgrading of the French.
You'd made us believe
economics were your main strength,
but you're leaving France
in a state that is unprecedented in its history:
an enormous debt, increasing bureaucracy,
a record trade deficit,
and over 9 million of our compatriots
who live under the poverty line.
You have made the French poorer,
sold off our industry and scorned our workers.
By destroying the country's economy,
by deciding arbitrarily who is essential
and who is not,
you have destroyed thousands of jobs,

you've put into debt
 our businesses, our merchants,
our restaurant owners, our hoteliers,
who can no longer breathe.
You have scorned our health workers,
locked away our youth and scared our elderly.
You have not lived up to your role
to protect the French.
The French know you are now part of those
who are responsible for
their replacement and their downgrading.
You have worsened their personal situations
and their country's.
Mister President, you must listen to the noise
that comes from the depths of our country.
The French are mad at you,

because once again these five years
 have been for nothing.
They think about their previous votes,
which were useless as well, and they are mad at you.
Your presidential term thus ends.
You will not be reelected.
You'll have ruled France for five years only,
and not one more day.
This is far too long.

The French people will not
 give you a second chance,
because you do not deserve it.
You will say it is impossible.

But no, taking back power from you
 is not impossible.
Redoing everything you have undone is possible.
Stopping immigration

and finally bringing peace
 to the French is possible.
Restoring the power of the state
and fighting bureaucracy is possible.

Liberating our economy and reasserting
 the value of work is possible.
Building a happy France is possible.
We deserve it. We are going to do it.
The French want radical change.

Therefore, we are going to
 reconquer our nation city by city,

village by village, business by business,
 school by school.
We're going to reconquer our identity,
our security, our prosperity,
our happiness and our pride!

I will be very happy,
 Mister President of the Republic,

to discuss this with you face to face
 and before the French
during the second-round debate.
Mister President of the Republic,
I wish France

to put an end democratically
 to your presidential term,
so that the Republic may live long,
and above all, so that France may live long.
